title: The burning bush not consumed wherein (either vnder all deepe sense of wrath; or hardnesse of heart, one may iudge, whether he be the childe of God, or not, &c. Chiefly receyuing satisfaction concerning the sinne against the Holy Ghost. Perused by I.D. and diuers other diuines.
author: Hart, John, D.D.
publisher: Printed by T[homas] C[reede] and B[ernard] A[lsop] for Roger Iackson, and are to be solde at his shoppe in Fleet-streete, ouer against the great Conduite,
notes: Editor's dedication signed "I. Hart" = John Hart.
A dialogue between a minister and a scholar.
Running title reads: A discouery of the child of God, vnder all sense of seeming wrath.
The title page is a cancel. Variant: title page is conjugate; comma after "bush"; line 11 reads ".. ond diners [sic] other diuines.".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
